;;

;;A; ;流行莫斯科; 3 月 22 日晚，一群蒙面枪手拿着自动步枪向摇滚演出现场的人群开枪，音乐厅变成了地狱般的犯罪现场。克洛库斯市政厅的视频显示，至少有四名男子在进入通往礼堂的门厅区域之前向手无寸铁的人开枪。官方媒体报道称，俄罗斯特种部队已开始袭击这座建筑，与此同时，不断有人员伤亡。俄罗斯官方媒体的初步报道称，至少 40 人死亡，100 多人受伤。

;

;关于正在发生的事件的第一份报告当地时间晚上 8 点 30 分左右，警方和紧急服务部门接到了红色警报。在接下来的一个小时内，听到两声不同的爆炸声，整个建筑群被烟雾和火焰包围，据报道数百人被困在里面。据官方媒体援引目击者的话称，枪手向排队等候进入大厅的迟到者开枪。有些人躲在厕所里，在通讯井里打洞，幸存下来。

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;“我们实际上是跳过尸体逃跑的”，一位名叫 Polina L 的女士告诉 112，与俄罗斯执法部门密切相关的社交媒体渠道。 “人们逃跑了，他们躲了起来……我们在几公里外搭便车，因为我们太害怕了，他们也会在街上开枪。”

;

;该事件发生两周前，西方大使馆警告莫斯科即将发生恐怖袭击，建议公民避免大型集会。在接下来的几天里，俄罗斯安全部门宣布他们挫败了对犹太教堂的袭击。据报道，3 月 9 日，两名哈萨克斯坦公民在与反恐官员的枪战中被杀。

;

;弗拉基米尔·普京总统后来选择驳回3 月 19 日，他在向最高级间谍发表年度讲话时发出了西方警告。据报道，他表示：“所有这些都像是公然的勒索，意图恐吓和破坏我们的社会稳定。”莫斯科东北部的零售和娱乐公园是欧洲最大的同类综合体之一，拥有自己的地铁站。它的音乐厅定期举办大型团体表演，例如原定于周五晚上表演的老牌摇滚歌手皮克尼克 (Piknik)。该场地之所以引人注目还有另一个原因。它的所有者是阿拉斯·阿加拉罗夫（Aras Agalarov），一位与普京关系密切的俄罗斯裔阿塞拜疆房地产开发商。一些报告将阿加拉罗夫先生视为 2016 年大选期间克里姆林宫和唐纳德·特朗普之间的渠道。

;

;谁可能是这次袭击的幕后黑手？不乏潜在嫌疑人。克里姆林宫在乌克兰残酷的两年战争制造了新的敌人，并增加了归国士兵中公开流通的武器数量。国内有强大的民族主义和治安运动。克里姆林宫参与车臣和达吉斯坦以及叙利亚等地的流血冲突，也使俄罗斯长期以来成为伊斯兰恐怖组织的目标。种族间的紧张局势不断加剧。对肇事者妄下结论是轻率的。

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;乌克兰立即否认参与了此次袭击。一位高级情报人士告诉《经济学人》，乌克兰政府一直担心克里姆林宫可能会试图将此类恐怖事件武器化，特别是在普京正在权衡是否要冒新一波恐怖袭击风险的时候。动员。消息人士称，有必要等待俄罗斯如何正式对这一事件进行分类：“无论他们会说是车臣还是达吉斯坦，也许我们以某种方式参与其中，或者只是直接指责我们。”现实情况是，乌克兰尝试任何此类行为都是纯粹的疯狂行为。杀害平民肯定会疏远乌克兰严重依赖的西方支持者。

;

;俄罗斯安全部副部长德米特里·梅德韦杰夫尽管如此，该委员会仍表示，至少俄罗斯高层中的一些人可能准备将这一事件归咎于乌克兰。他在社交媒体网络 Telegram 上写道：“如果确定这些人是基辅政权的恐怖分子……他们所有人都必须作为恐怖分子被发现并被无情地消灭……死吧。”梅德韦杰夫先生是前总理兼总统，一度被认为是俄罗斯自由派，最近却成为政府思想中更极端分子的代言人。;■;< /p>;; https://www.economist.com/europe/2024/03/22/who-is-behind-an-attack-that-killed-dozens-in-a-moscow-concert-hall /内容/0ep7tce07cnp5pmq89lq596uaumi5edf Fri, 22 Mar 2024 21:39:22 GMT俄罗斯 威尔士王妃的癌症诊断是一次非常公开的折磨

;;C;;威尔士王妃阿瑟琳;宣布她患有癌症。公爵夫人在一月份接受了腹部大手术，她在 3 月 22 日发布的视频声明中表示，她的病情最初被认为是非癌症；但后来的测试发现癌症已经存在。她现在正处于预防性化疗的早期阶段。她将这一诊断描述为“巨大的震惊”。

;

;问题不在于这对公主意味着什么。几乎不需要想象就能知道一位带着三个年幼孩子的母亲在 42 岁时被诊断出患有癌症的感受。公主在声明中表示，她和她的丈夫威尔士亲王威廉一直在尽一切努力。可以向乔治、夏洛特和路易斯解释一切，并“让他们放心我会没事的”。

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;更大的问题是，如果有的话，这对于皇室来说意味着。作为继承人，查尔斯王子（现为国王）长期以来一直表示他想要一个精简的君主制。很少有人会想到，它的工作队伍会如此迅速地缩减，或者在近年来如此严峻的情况下缩减。一个几十年来看似难以置信的热情的家庭突然开始变得不那么热情了。

;

;爱丁堡公爵菲利普亲王去世2021 年，女王也于 2022 年去世。查尔斯国王于 2 月被诊断出患有（尚未披露的）癌症；现在威尔士王妃也是如此。威廉王子自然要抽出时间来照顾她和他的家人。查尔斯国王的弟弟安德鲁王子于 2022 年因性侵犯案被剥夺了王室赞助权和军事头衔（他在庭外和解）；哈里王子于 2020 年不再担任在职王室成员。在短短四年内，“公司”失去了一位女王和一位公爵，目前又因疾病、愚蠢和不和而失去了三位王子和一位公主。

;

;曾经，皇室队伍的如此精简并没有多大影响。几个世纪以来，英国只有国王和王后：王室统治者的成败只取决于一个人，那就是君主。但自维多利亚女王时代以来，英国不仅有君主，还有王室。王室成员的工作就是上演一场精彩的表演。

;

;可见度是王室成员的重点：“我必须被看到值得相信”，伊丽莎白二世女王在皇家之旅中身着彩虹般明亮的色彩出发时常常这样说道。其他王室成员制造的许多头条新闻——从离婚到卫生棉条再到吮脚趾——也必须亲眼所见才能相信。皇室成员都意识到他们是来表演的，总的来说，他们不得不上演一场悲喜剧。英国乃至全世界都非常欣赏这场表演。

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;在二十一世纪，喜剧已经相当褪色；观众还没有。自从公主手术的消息发布后的几个月里，阴谋论——从凯特患有贪食症的想法到凯特实际上已经死亡的猜测——一直盛行。一张为母亲节发布的照片​​受到广泛审查，并因 ;被操纵;。据报道，她接受治疗的医院的工作人员试图获取她的记录。

;

;但是，王室成员的胃口很大相当合理地，被监视的情况已经减少了。凯特在声明中说：“我们希望你们能够理解，作为一个家庭，在我完成治疗期间，我们现在需要一些时间、空间和隐私。”尽管许多旁观者可能会感到受到惩罚，但很难想象英国或世界会给她这样的机会。 ;■;

;

;多少太多？荷兰乌得勒支大学的英格丽·罗伯恩（Ingrid Robeyns）是“限制主义”的作者，他认为国家应防止任何人积累超过1000万美元（或磅或欧元；这是一个粗略的数字）。除了艰难的“政治限制”之外，她认为“道德限制”应该较低。在国家支付医疗保健和养老金的国家，没有人应该积蓄超过100万美元的储蓄，社会应该嘲笑任何人。

;作者提供了许多厌恶加载的原因。他们对环境不利，私人喷气机和偶尔在太空中度过假期。他们通过拥有多个房屋来加剧住房短缺。他们中的一些人购买了政治影响力。一些人腐败地获得了财富。实用主义者可以通过对碳排放征税，允许建造更多房屋，收紧竞选财务法律或破坏腐败的情况，直接解决这些问题。但是对于Robeyns和Hildyard先生而言，一切都取决于将富人缩小到大小。

;

;他们提出了合理的观点。穷人比富人要多的$ 1,000要大。一个饥饿的家庭可以购买几个月的食物；银行家可能会在一次晚餐中吹牛，不包括葡萄酒。不过，作者走得更远，归咎于许多疾病的不平等现象。他们认为（没有老鼠种族！）和更凝聚的（不太嫉妒！），一个根本上平等的社会将减轻压力。富人ho积的钱可以用来提升穷人并改善公共服务。

;;T;;HE CO-FOUNDER; of the Miami marathon, Frankie Ruiz, was once asked on the radio if he was related to the most famous marathon cheat of all time. Rosie Ruiz ran just one of the expected 26 miles (42km) to win the Boston marathon of 1980. But though she may share Mr Ruiz's name and Cuban heritage, the similarities end there. Mr Ruiz is even mulling an expensive investment—;AI;-powered facial-recognition cameras—to ensure that no runner, be they first or last, ever pulls a Rosie during one of his events.

;

;Cheating in distance running has a long and varied history. At the 1904 Olympics in St Louis, Frederick Lorz, a 20-year-old bricklayer, hopped into a car after around ten miles of the marathon. He found the strength to resume ten miles later and finished, to no great surprise, in first place. He allowed a wreath to be laid upon his head before his unsanctioned assistance was revealed.

;
;

;Lorz seems to have been an opportunist. (The St Louis race, organised by a madman who did not believe in hydration, was by all accounts hellish.) Others did a bit more preparation. During a 54-mile ultra-marathon in 1999, a South African runner, Sergio Motsoeneng, shared running duties with his brother, with whom he swapped clothes in a toilet. The prize money Mr Motsoeneng would have won for finishing tenth, with rather less than 54 miles under his belt, would have done a lot for his nine siblings. In 2010 Kip Litton went so far as to concoct his own marathon in Wyoming, pose as its race director under a different name and declare himself the winner. Mr Litton has said that the event was a legitimate attempt at a marathon, but he agreed that a friend could falsify names of other participants when no one else showed up on the day.

;

;Marathon cheats pose a special sort of problem.精英运动员与周末战士共享道路。第一组受到严格监管：如果您要登上领奖台，您将接受药物测试并进行直播。人们确实会碰碰运气。 (The Athletics Integrity Unit, an anti-doping watchdog, maintains a list of banned athletes.) But blatant course-cutting is not a realistic proposition for the speedsters.

;

;Runners back in the pack are less likely to be spotted. Cheating is not exactly rampant—the curious case of the Mexico City marathon of 2023, in which roughly a third of participants were disqualified, is an exception. But though it seems akin to cheating at the crossword, amateur cheating happens;.; And when ordinary people face such allegations, it is generally ordinary people who make them.

;

;Derek Murphy, a data analyst from Ohio, has published claims about scores of amateur runners on his website, Marathon Investigation. He scans race results, calculating missed splits—interim times usually recorded automatically when runners pass over mats—to see if they stack up. If a racer's finishing time makes sense only if four-minute miles were sandwiched between eight-minute ones, he probably used a bicycle somewhere. Mr Murphy also buys race photos, zooming in on athletes' ;GPS; watches, which show various details relating to their run. He once got a runner disqualified by showing that according to her watch she had run just 11.6 miles of a 13.1-mile race.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;His project is divisive. 2019年，一名被他指控连续作弊的70岁跑步者自杀了。墨菲先生最终发现自己站在了互联网暴徒的另一边，而他经常被指责煽动这些暴民。他说，他现在重点关注那些根据业绩打造个人或商业品牌的人。 “网红”的崛起让指责显得更有道理。奖金可能不会受到威胁，但赞助和自我意识却受到威胁。拉夫堡大学的历史学家和超级马拉松运动员萨姆·爱德华兹将这个跑步时代描述为“竞技生活方式表现”之一。 He compares cheating in races to “photo-shopping an insta image before posting”: both tweak reality in pursuit of realistic-enough perfection.

;

;Flora Beverley, a British runfluencer, concedes that social media creates pressures to perform. Her kosher but disappointing time of four and a half hours in her first marathon earned her “so much hate”. But she insists that the risks of cheating are worse. Social media magnifies the incentives to fudge times, but also makes it harder to get away with. For every social-media influencer, says one running coach in Brooklyn, there is a social-media sleuth.

;

;Of course, these self-appointed investigators are not always right. Naming suspected amateur cheats delivers thrills like a video game. But the effects reverberate in the real world. A private email to a race director would be a wiser place to start than a speculative public post. It is also true, though, that when the detectives of the running world turn probing or nasty, influencers may forget that they have encouraged the attention. They, more than many, can understand the desire for a bigger stage. ;■;

;;W;;ITH LESS ;than a month to go before ;India's general election ;, when ;Narendra Modi's ; Bharatiya Janata Party (;BJP;) is widely expected to retain power, the opposition coalition is a shambles. This is only partly its own doing. India's law-enforcement agencies have played a not insignificant role.

;

;On March 21st the Enforcement Directorate (;ED;) , a federal agency tasked with investigating large-scale economic offences, arrested Arvind Kejriwal, the chief minister of Delhi, a leading figure in the main opposition alliance and a thorn in the side of the prime minister.

;The arrest had been widely expected. The ;ED; has “summoned” Mr Kejriwal for questioning nine times since October;, ;which he gleefully and publicly ignored.然而，当这个消息在3月21日晚传出时，仍然令人震惊。这是印度历史上首次现任首席部长被捕。 And it is only the latest misfortune to strike the anti-;BJP; coalition. In January the chief minister of Jharkhand, an opposition-run eastern state, resigned just hours before he too was arrested by the ;ED;, in his case on suspicion of money-laundering. This week the Congress party, the only big national party other than the ;BJP;, said its bank accounts had been frozen by the tax authorities over alleged undeclared cash income of 1.5m rupees ($18,000), or about 0.07% of its total donation income, in the 2017-18 financial year.

;

;

;Maybe the timing is pure coincidence.政府表示，执法机构只是在履行职责。 The; BJP; rode to power in 2014 on, among other things, popular disgust with corruption. The last term of the previous, Congress-led, coalition had been marked by a seemingly never-ending cascade of exposés by India's then muckraking media. Many voters remain wedded to the idea that Mr Modi is incorruptible. Some believe that applies to his party too.

;

;Perhaps it is true 。 That would explain why the ;ED; and the Central Bureau of Investigation (;CBI;), another law-enforcement agency, both of which are controlled by the central government, have been so energetic in their investigations of parties other than the ;BJP;.自 2014 年以来，该机构约 95% 的调查都集中在反对派身上。 Under the Congress-led coalition over the previous ten years, just 54% of ;ED; investigations and 60% of ;CBI; ones went after the opposition, according to an investigation by the ;Indian Express;, a national daily. The ;BJP;'s halo extends to new members too. The agencies have ceased or eased investigations against opposition politicians after they defected to the ruling party.

;

;The particulars of the case against Mr Kejriwal relate to a new liquor policy introduced by his government in 2021. The; ED; and the ;CBI; allege that Mr Kejriwal's Aam Aadmi Party (;AAP;) received around 1bn rupees in kickbacks from a group of businessmen in exchange for lucrative alcohol licences. Two other senior ;AAP; lieutenants are already in jail pending trial as part of the case, including Mr Kejriwal's deputy, who was arrested in February 2023. The ;ED; says Mr Kejriwal has failed to co-operate with the probe and that his arrest is necessary to establish what role he played in the alleged corruption.尽管该机构进行了多次突击搜查并逮捕了总共 16 名调查人员，但尚未对任何被告进行审判。 ;AAP; says the investigation is a political conspiracy.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;The irony is that Mr Kejriwal rose to political prominence as a campaigner against graft under the previous Congress-led government.该党的标志是一把扫帚，象征着扫除腐败。其他反对派领导人纷纷支持凯杰里瓦尔。 “A scared dictator wants to create a dead democracy,” Rahul Gandhi, figurehead of the Congress, wrote on X, formerly Twitter.喀拉拉邦首席部长皮纳拉伊·维贾扬 (Pinarayi Vijayan) 称，凯杰里瓦尔的被捕“完全是恶毒的，是大选前压制所有反对派声音的冷酷阴谋的一部分”。 MK Stalin, the chief minister of Tamil Nadu, said it laid bare the ;BJP;'s abuse of power and the “decay of democracy”.

;

;Mr Kejriwal has consistently denied wrongdoing, and justified his refusal to appear for questioning before the ;ED; by calling the summons “illegal”.他正在法庭上对他的逮捕提出质疑。 But whatever the judges decide, the saga will probably hurt the opposition more than the ;BJP;.如果凯杰里瓦尔先生仍被关在监狱里，反对派联盟将失去一位重要的活动人士。 Even if he is released, he will have been robbed of some of his moral power, and his image is likely to be tarnished. ;■;

;Another sensible adjustment to evaluating the job performance under each president is to apply a one-year lag.这里的逻辑是，总统需要一段时间才能站稳脚跟，开始制定政策——从行政命令到立法——定义他们的政治遗产。特朗普在上任第一年接近尾声时将全面减税法案签署为法律。拜登先生以新冠复苏刺激措施起步更快。但他的其他重大举措，包括基础设施投资计划，却花了更长的时间才获得通过。 And companies, individuals and investors need even more time to digest policy shifts.

;Looking at median monthly job creation in each presidency, lagged by one year, Mr Biden holds on to the top spot.但特朗普紧随其后，排名第二，里根排名第三。总体而言，民主党的表现仍然优于共和党，但差距再次比以前小得多：民主党每月就业岗位中位数为 205,000 个，而共和党为 150,000 个（见图 5）。对于民主党来说，这一数字仍然高出 40% 左右——这是一个相当大的差距。 But in an economy as big and diverse as America's, with so many exogenous variables at play, it would be a stretch to ascribe that difference to the occupant of the White House. ;;F;;ROM TIME; to time a chart circulates showing that virtually every job new in America over the past 35 years was created under a Democratic president (see chart 1). Often, the chart goes viral, and Democrats are only too happy to boast of their job-creating prowess. Since 1989 a mere 1.3m jobs have been created in net terms with Republicans in the Oval Office—despite the party's reputation for being more business-friendly. With Democrats in power a net 49.4m jobs have been added. Defined narrowly—just considering monthly employment figures—the chart is indeed accurate. But a closer look at the data paints a different picture, showing a less marked contrast.

;Start with a simple point. It would be astonishing if the parties' shifting fortunes truly led to such wildly different outcomes, almost overnight, for the American economy. Many things feed into growth trends that have only a scant connection to whoever is living in the White House—from the business cycle to tech innovations and Federal Reserve decisions to the global economy. At a minimum several adjustments to the jobs data are needed to make a fairer comparison.

;
;;;

;Our first adjustment is to the period of time. Beginning with the presidency of George HW Bush in 1989 skews the outcome, since it omits America's job performance under Ronald Reagan, who presided over a boom in the 1980s. It is fairer to date America's modern economic trends to the late 1970s, and Jimmy Carter's one-term presidency (see chart 2).这也涵盖了共和党和民主党在白宫任职时间大致相等的时期，均为 24 年。在此期间，共和党总统执政期间创造了 1700 万个就业岗位，而民主党总统则创造了 6000 万个就业岗位。 That is still a big gap (about 3.5 times as many jobs were created under Democrats as under Republicans) but not as large as the chasm that appears if the analysis starts in 1989 (a ratio of 39 to one).
